item.title: CEEMPC session: Licensing, How To Tackle The Value Gap And A Discussion On Licensing Initiatives
Royalties
item.description: Royalties are earnings on intellectual properties. In music, they are the earnings of the music composer, the performer and the producer and the recorded performance. Creators of films, books, software, and other artistic works or intellectual products are entitled to various forms of royalties. Many royalties are collectively managed, like the musicians pay after radio or restaurant plays. Other royalties, like revenues of app developers, are directly or indirectly paid to them by the buyer of their products.

item.title: Analysis of the Hungarian Private Copy Remuneration Scheme
item.description: The original title in Hungarian is Az üreshordozó díjrendszer vizsgálata.
